conclusion: Identify the current position and size of A, B, C, and D.
A is the shadow of the apple, located to the left of the apple.
B is the shadow of the paper, located to the right of the paper.
C is the shadow of the glass, located to the left of the glass.
D is the shadow of the chicken, located to the right of the chicken.
Determine the direction of the light source.
The light source is coming from the front left, as indicated by the direction of the shadows.
Analyze the effect of moving the light source to the back right.
When the light source moves to the back right, the shadows will shift to the left and become smaller.
A will move to the left and become smaller because the light source is moving away from the apple.
B will move to the left and become smaller because the light source is moving away from the paper.
C will move to the left and become smaller because the light source is moving away from the glass.
D will move to the left and become smaller because the light source is moving away from the chicken.
Summarize the changes in the position and size of A, B, C, and D.
A will move to the left and become smaller.
B will move to the left and become smaller.
C will move to the left and become smaller.
D will move to the left and become smaller.
